oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Capitol of Tennessee, circa 1859
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A page from a mounted and bound volume of twenty-five pen-and-ink wash drawings, and two pen-and-ink maps of Nashville created by William A. Eichbaum during the 1850s. Eichbaum was a Nashville bookseller and resident for fifty years. This drawing is of the Tennessee State Capitol building, erected between 1845 and 1855. The architect, William Strickland, died a year before the building's completion and is entombed in its northeast wall. The Capitol is located atop a hill on Charlotte Avenue, between Sixth and Seventh Avenues, in downtown Nashville. Forms part of the William A. Eichbaum Sketchbook. 1 drawing : col. ; 5.75 x 9 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Eichbaum, William A., 1787-1873--Notebooks, sketchbooks, etc.
